intro: Limeum rhombifolium, commonly known as the diamond-leaved plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive rhombus-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Due to its unique foliage, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
